item.title: 页岩油公司高管认为收购将挤压美国石油产量
item.description: 达拉斯联邦储备银行的一项调查显示，如果席卷页岩产业的企业收购热潮持续下去，美国的石油产量将会下降。【原文：US oil production will decline if the corporate-acquisition spree sweeping the shale sector is prolonged, according to a Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas survey.】

item.title: 卢拉巩固了巴西央行向连续 CPI 目标的转变
item.description: 巴西总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）周三宣布，巴西将采用新的通胀目标制，央行将设定连续 12 个月的通胀目标。【原文：Brazil will adopt a new inflation targeting regime that will see its central bank set goals for continuous 12-month periods, a change cemented by President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva on Wednesday.】

item.title: 韩国加密货币投资公司 Hashed 进军阿布扎比
item.description: 阿布扎比有利的监管环境使其成为全球最热门的加密货币中心之一，Hashed Ventures 是最新一家在阿布扎比拓展业务的数字资产公司。【原文：Hashed Ventures is the latest digital-asset company to expand its footprint in Abu Dhabi, where an advantageous regulatory environment has made it one of the hottest global crypto hubs.】

item.title: Neil Dutta 认为美联储可能从 "偷梁换柱 "的数据中发现错误
item.description:
只有两个数据点是重要的

【原文：

item.title: Rivian 30% 的涨幅仍留下 1,380 亿美元的估值缺口
item.description: 由于投资者对大众汽车公司计划投资电动汽车制造商 Rivian Automotive Inc.从更广阔的视角来看，这一涨势更像是屏幕上的一个小插曲。【原文：Rivian Automotive Inc. shares soared on Wednesday as investors cheered Volkswagen AG’s planned investment in the electric-vehicle maker. Viewed from a wider lens, the rally looks more like a blip on the screen.】

item.title: 随着 PE 投资者对现金的追捧，战神公司的阿鲁格赫蒂看到了更多的交易机会
item.description: 战神管理公司（Ares Management Corp.首席执行官 Mike Arougheti 表示，随着私募股权赞助商寻找现金，该公司为中型市场收购提供贷款的渠道正在不断扩大。【原文：Ares Management Corp. Chief Executive Officer Mike Arougheti said the firm’s pipeline for lending to middle-market buyouts — a key business area — is growing as private equity sponsors look for cash.】

item.title: 斯洛伐克保护天然气供应商免受俄罗斯供应的法律风险
item.description: 由于担心俄罗斯天然气欧洲买家的付款可能会被扣押，斯洛伐克已采取行动保护其主要天然气供应商免受法律索赔，此前一家法院裁定德国公用事业公司 Uniper SE 因未交付俄罗斯天然气工业股份公司（Gazprom）供应的天然气而获得损害赔偿。【原文：Slovakia has moved to protect its main gas provider from legal claims on concerns that payments from European buyers of Russian gas could get seized after a court awarded damages to German utility Uniper SE for undelivered Gazprom supplies.】

item.title: 诺和诺德公司因心脏药物失败而承担 8.2 亿美元费用
item.description: 诺和诺德公司（Novo Nordisk A/S）表示，在停止了去年收购的一种实验性心脏病药物的后期研究后，该公司将计提约 57 亿丹麦克朗（约合 8.2 亿美元）的减值损失。【原文：Novo Nordisk A/S said it will take an impairment of about 5.7 billion Danish kroner ($820 million) after halting a late-stage study of an experimental heart drug it acquired last year.】

item.title: 日元疲软为避开债券提供又一理由，国债下跌
item.description: 国债收益率下跌，使大多数国债收益率达到一周多来的最高水平，因为日币币值的最新下滑加剧了债券投资者的焦虑情绪。【原文：Treasuries fell, sending most yields to the highest levels in more than a week, as the latest slide in the value of the Japanese currency compounded bond investors’ anxiety.】

item.title: 桑坦德银行与普华永道续签 1.4 亿美元审计合同
item.description: 桑坦德银行（Banco Santander SA）决定与普华永道会计师事务所（PriceWaterhouseCoopers LLP）续签审计服务合同，有可能将欧洲最大的审计事务所之一的关系维持到 2035 年。【原文：Banco Santander SA decided to renew its contract for audit services with PriceWaterhouseCoopers LLP, potentially keeping one of Europe’s biggest such relationships with the firm until 2035.】

item.title: SNB 新任女利率制定者不太可能挑战现状
item.description: 她可能只是瑞士国家银行利率制定委员会中的第二位女性成员，但在其他大多数方面，佩特拉-楚丁都与她的同事们如出一辙。【原文：She may only be the second woman to ever sit on the Swiss National Bank’s rate-setting board, but in most other respects, Petra Tschudin is cut from the same cloth as her colleagues.】

item.title: 八年来首次首次公开募股标志着乌拉圭深化市场的举措
item.description: 本周，Zorzal Inversiones Tecnologicas 公司将成为乌拉圭近八年来首家进行首次公开募股的公司，此前当局放宽了对小公司融资的规定。【原文：Zorzal Inversiones Tecnologicas will become the first company in Uruguay to conduct an initial public offering in almost eight years this week, after authorities eased the rules on small companies to raise capital.】

item.title: 日元兑欧元汇率跌至逾 25 年最弱水平
item.description: 日元兑欧洲共同货币汇率跌至历史最弱水平，此举凸显了日本货币的顽固贬值。【原文：The yen slumped to its weakest level on record against Europe’s common currency, a move that highlights the Japanese currency’s stubborn depreciation.】

item.title: 两希格玛饮料公司支持由分析师领导的对冲基金初创公司
item.description: 一家新成立的对冲基金避开了价格昂贵的投资组合经理，只招聘分析师来管理资金，并以较低的成本复制一些最大的同行所创造的回报。【原文：A new hedge fund is shunning pricey portfolio managers by recruiting only analysts to run money and replicate returns generated by some of its largest peers but at a lower cost.】

item.title: 冷藏房地产投资信托基金 Lineage 与 20 多家银行合作申请美国 IPO
item.description: 随着新股市场的复苏，温控存储和物流巨头 Lineage Inc.【原文：Temperature-controlled storage and logistics giant Lineage Inc. filed for an initial public offering, as the recovery in the market for new listings gains steam.】

item.title: 肯尼亚总统屈服于压力，取消 23 亿美元税收计划
item.description: 肯尼亚总统威廉-鲁托（William Ruto）表示，他将撤回一项有争议的税收法案，向公众压力低头。此前，有人对这项计划提出了致命的抗议，要求征收 23 亿美元的新税款，导致至少 23 人死亡。【原文：Kenyan President William Ruto said he’s withdrawing a contentious tax bill, bowing to public pressure after deadly protests against the plan to raise $2.3 billion in new levies led to the deaths of at least 23 people.】

item.title: 除非钯金回升，否则西班业公司 "将不得不 "关闭美国矿山
item.description: Sibanye Stillwater Ltd.首席执行官尼尔-弗罗曼（Neal Froneman）表示，如果价格不能尽快回升，该公司将被迫停止蒙大拿州钯矿的运营。【原文：Sibanye Stillwater Ltd. will be forced to halt operations at its Montana palladium mine if prices don’t recover soon, according to Chief Executive Office Neal Froneman.】

item.title: 乌克兰为何需要与债券持有人达成新协议
item.description: 距离 200 亿美元债券的两年延期偿付期结束、乌克兰必须恢复向私人债权人支付利息的时间仅剩几周。有关重组的谈判至今未能达成协议，双方在债券持有人应牺牲多少投资的问题上僵持不下。【原文：Ukraine has just a few weeks left before a two-year moratorium on $20 billion of bonds ends and it has to resume interest payments to private creditors. Talks about a restructuring have so far failed to yield a deal, with the parties at loggerheads over how much of their investment bondholders should sacrifice.】

item.title: Interactive Brokers 因纽约证券交易所故障损失 4800 万美元
item.description: Interactive Brokers Group Inc. 在本月纽约证券交易所交易中断后损失了 4800 万美元，该公司正在考虑收回这笔钱的各种方案，包括可能的法律诉讼。【原文：Interactive Brokers Group Inc. took a $48 million hit after a New York Stock Exchange trading disruption this month and is considering its options to recover the money, including possible legal action.】

item.title: 美元飙升至 2024 年新高，因美联储与主要同行立场不同
item.description: 由于美联储首次降息似乎遥遥无期，衡量美元强弱的一个指标升至 11 月以来的最高水平。【原文：A gauge of the dollar’s strength rose to its highest level since November as the first interest-rate reduction from the Federal Reserve appears distant.】

item.title: 日本神田表示高度关注日元走势
item.description: 日本货币局局长称，日本政府正在高度紧迫地关注日元走势，并称日元最近的走势是 "快速 "和 "单边 "的。【原文：Japan’s currency chief said the government is watching the yen with a high level of urgency as he described the currency’s latest moves as “rapid” and “one sided.”】

item.title: 瑞士选择连续性，SNB 行长将由施莱格尔担任
item.description: 瑞士国家银行副行长马丁-施莱格尔（Martin Schlegel）在政府选择不任命外部人士而避免动荡之后，赢得了晋升该机构最高职位的机会。【原文：Swiss National Bank Vice President Martin Schlegel won promotion to the institution’s top job after the government opted against rocking the boat by appointing an outsider.】

item.title: 北约盟国努力就乌克兰的长期资金问题达成一致意见
item.description: 北约的几个盟国对承诺向乌克兰提供军事援助的具体多年期支出承诺持反对意见，该承诺旨在为基辅提供更多长期可预测性。【原文：Several NATO allies are balking at committing to a specific multi-year spending pledge on military aid for Ukraine that’s aimed at giving Kyiv more predictability over the long term.】

item.title: 李克强敦促加强对毕业生的就业支持
item.description: 中国国务院总理李强呼吁针对包括大学毕业生和农民工在内的关键群体出台更多就业政策，以促进中国劳动力市场的发展。【原文：Chinese Premier Li Qiang called for more job policies targeting key groups including college graduates and migrant workers, in an effort to boost the country’s labor market.】

item.title: 克罗地亚总统米拉诺维奇表示将竞选连任
item.description: 克罗地亚总统佐兰-米拉诺维奇（Zoran Milanovic）周三表示，他计划在今年 12 月的选举中竞选第二个五年任期，他的职责包括监督北约成员国的武装部队。【原文：Croatian President Zoran Milanovic, whose duties include overseeing the NATO member’s armed forces, said Wednesday that he’s planning to run for a second five-year term in elections this December.】

item.title: CFA 一级通过率升至 46%，再次超过历史平均水平
item.description: 特许金融分析师一级考试的通过率跃升至 46%，超过了历史平均水平；不过，已经推迟考试的考生的成功率要低得多。【原文：The pass rate for the first level of the chartered financial analyst exam jumped above its historic average to 46% — though test takers who’d already delayed their exam had a much lower success rate.】

item.title: 彭博投资峰会更新
item.description: 2024 年 6 月 25 日星期二，在美国纽约举行的彭博投资大会上展示的 sigange。会议邀请资产管理、银行、财富和私人市场领域的领导者跟踪、剖析和预测未来最大的变化、风险和机遇。【原文：A sigange displays during the Bloomberg Invest event in New York, US, on Tuesday, June 25, 2024. The conference invites leaders in asset management, banking, wealth, and private markets to track, dissect, and predict the future's greatest changes, risks and opportunities.】

item.title: 欧盟就针对俄罗斯规避制裁的白俄罗斯制裁措施达成一致
item.description: 欧盟各国大使同意对白俄罗斯实施新的一揽子制裁，因为欧盟试图打击俄罗斯规避因入侵乌克兰而实施的惩罚的行为。【原文：European Union ambassadors agreed to a new package of sanctions on Belarus as the bloc tries to crack down on Russia’s circumvention of penalties imposed over its invasion of Ukraine.】

item.title: 巴西公司斥资 1.5 亿美元收购农业巨头最炙手可热的资产
item.description: 在过去十年中，拥有农田已被证明是巴西最好的投资之一。但仅限于巴西人。【原文：Owning farmland has proven one of the best investments in Brazil over the past decade. But only for Brazilians.】

item.title: 斯里兰卡与官方债权人达成最终债务重组协议
item.description: 据斯里兰卡总统的媒体部门称，斯里兰卡与双边贷款人官方债权人委员会就 58 亿美元的债务达成了最终重组协议。【原文：Sri Lanka reached a final restructuring agreement for $5.8 billion of debt with the Official Creditor Committee of bilateral lenders, according to the president’s media division.】
